article_title: HCA Hospitals Claim Aetna Owes $16.4M In ER Payments
article_text:
HCA Hospitals Claim Aetna Owes $16.4M In ER Payments

Law360, New York (October 2, 2015, 8:07 PM ET) -- Aetna Life Insurance Co. has cheated more than two dozen hospitals owned by HCA Holdings Inc. out of a combined $16.4 million for emergency services provided to patients who received Aetna coverage through the Affordable Care Act, according to a suit removed Thursday to Florida federal court.



The insurer has refused to add the 27 HCA hospitals to its network, but has reimbursed them less than it does for in-network providers, according to the suit. For the $21 million in emergency services charged to Aetna in...
